Meta.description: Ink is a modern digital library for reading books, comics, manga, and manhwa online. Create collections, leave reviews, and discover new stories.
Meta.profile_description: View reading progress, collections, reviews, and stats. Connect with others and personalize your digital library profile.
Meta.default_description: Read online on Ink – a digital library for manga, comics, and novels. Track your reading, write reviews, and discover new stories.
Meta.catalog_description: Browse all available books, manga, comics and more
Meta.reviews_description: Read the latest reviews of books, comics, and graphic novels on the Ink platform. Reader opinions, ratings, and discussions.
Meta.review_description: A review by {username} of "{title}". Rating: {rating}/10. Read their thoughts and leave yours!
Meta.login_description: Log in to Ink and continue reading where you left off. Personalized recommendations, bookmarks, reviews — all at your fingertips.
Meta.register_description: Register on Ink to read your favorite books, comics, and novels, track your progress, create collections, and share reviews.

Privacy.meta_description: Learn how Ink processes, stores, and protects your personal information. Transparent rules on registration, cookies, third-party services, and security.
Privacy.meta_og_desc: Ink takes your privacy seriously. Learn how we collect and protect your personal data.
Privacy.meta_tw_desc: How Ink processes user data: registration, security, cookies, third-party services, and user rights.
Privacy.title: Privacy Policy
Privacy.intro: At Ink, we respect your right to privacy and are committed to protecting every user's personal data. This document explains how we collect, process, and safeguard information.
Privacy.section1_intro: We may collect the following data:
Privacy.section1_item4: Social network identifiers (when logging in via Google, GitHub, Discord)
Privacy.section1_item5: Technical data: IP address, browser type, language, login time
Privacy.section2_intro: Your data is used solely for the following purposes:
Privacy.section3_body: All personal data is stored in a secure MongoDB database. Data is transmitted via secure channels (HTTPS) and is not shared with third parties without user consent. We use JWT and OAuth2 authentication to protect accounts.
Privacy.section4_body: We may use cookies to store session data, interface language, and authorization token. You can limit cookie usage in your browser settings.
Privacy.section5_body: We may integrate third-party services: Google Auth, Discord Auth, AWS S3 (for storing covers, banners). They may receive technical data needed for authentication or file processing.
Privacy.section6_item1: Receive a copy of your personal data
Privacy.section6_item2: Edit or delete data via your profile or by contacting support
Privacy.section6_item3: Withdraw consent for processing (by deleting your account)
Privacy.section6_item4: Restrict processing or file a complaint in accordance with the law
Privacy.section7_body: We may update this policy to reflect functional or legal changes. All updates will be posted on this page with the corresponding date.

Offer.meta_description: Learn about the terms of using the Ink platform: user rights and responsibilities, restrictions, liability, and donation policy.
Offer.title: Public Offer / User Agreement
Offer.intro: This Offer is a legally binding agreement between you — the User — and the administration of the Ink digital library (hereinafter referred to as the “Platform” or “Service”), which governs the terms of using the Platform’s functionality, content, and services. Acceptance of this Offer occurs through actual use of the Service: account registration, browsing pages, creating content, or sending requests.
Offer.s1_1: Platform / Service / Ink — the digital online library available at https://ink-three.vercel.app.
Offer.s1_2: User / Participant / Reader — any individual using the Platform.
Offer.s1_4: Content — texts, images, reviews, comments, and works published by the User.
Offer.s1_5: Author — a User who publishes original works on the Platform.
Offer.s1_6: Acceptance — actual use of the Platform, confirming agreement with this Offer’s terms.
Offer.s2_1: Do not post content that infringes on copyrights or other rights of third parties.
Offer.s2_2: Report unauthorized access to your account to the administration.
Offer.s2_3: Refrain from insults, hate, or discriminatory speech in comments and reviews.
Offer.s2_4: Compensate for damage caused to the Service or other users through your actions.
Offer.s3_1: Do not interfere with the Platform’s operation or abuse its functionality.
Offer.s3_2: Do not collect other users’ personal data without consent.
Offer.s3_3: Do not post offensive, discriminatory, fake, or illegal content.
Offer.s4_1: Suspend or delete an account if the terms are violated.
Offer.s4_2: Delete or moderate content without prior notice.
Offer.s4_3: Introduce paid features or change the rules.
Offer.s4_4: Retain content even after account deletion — within legal limits.
Offer.s5_1: The Service does not guarantee uninterrupted or error-free operation.
Offer.s5_2: The Service is not responsible for actions of users or third parties.
Offer.s5_3: All information and content are published at the User’s own risk.
Offer.s5_4: The Service does not guarantee it will meet the User’s expectations.
Offer.s6_2: The Platform acts as an agent in collecting donations for Authors.
Offer.s6_3: Authors are required to pay an agency fee.
Offer.s6_4: The Platform is not responsible for relationships between Users and Authors.
Offer.s7_1: The Platform is not recommended for persons under 16 without parental consent.
Offer.s7_2: Users are responsible for the accuracy of their age information.
Offer.s8_text: The terms of this Offer may be changed without individual notice. The current version is always available on this page.

DMCA.meta_description: Information for rights holders on submitting copyright infringement complaints on the Ink platform. We comply with the DMCA and Ukrainian law.
DMCA.meta_og_desc: The Ink platform supports intellectual property protection. Learn how to file a DMCA complaint or report a copyright violation.
DMCA.meta_tw_desc: Clarification on copyright compliance on the Ink platform. How to submit a complaint and what requirements must be met.
DMCA.title: DMCA – For Rights Holders
DMCA.p1: The administration of the Ink platform, available online at https://ink-three.vercel.app, respects intellectual property rights and operates in accordance with the Digital Millennium Copyright Act (DMCA) and current Ukrainian legislation.
DMCA.p2: We act as an information intermediary and are not responsible for content published by users. However, in cases of copyright infringement, we take prompt action to remove or restrict access to infringing materials.
DMCA.how_intro: If you are a rights holder and believe your copyright has been violated on the Ink Platform, you may submit an official notice of infringement to: juliamalanjuk@gmail.com
DMCA.how_must_include: The notice must include the following:
DMCA.how_1: Your full name or company name
DMCA.how_3: Link to the page where the allegedly infringing content is located
DMCA.how_4: Description of the copyrighted work that has been infringed
DMCA.how_5: Confirmation that you are the rights holder or an authorized representative
DMCA.after_notice: After receiving the notice, we may temporarily block or remove the corresponding content while the matter is investigated.
DMCA.warn_body: Submitting false or misleading information may result in legal liability, including compensation for damages and legal costs. We recommend consulting a lawyer before submitting a complaint.
DMCA.limit_1: The Ink administration does not pre-moderate user content and does not have the technical ability to control every publication. All information is posted independently by users without administrative intervention.
DMCA.limit_2: Nevertheless, we facilitate prompt responses to rights holders' requests and are ready to cooperate within the framework of applicable law.

FAQ.meta_description: Find answers to popular questions about the Ink platform: reading, lists, registration, publishing, and the mobile app.
FAQ.meta_og_desc: How to use Ink? Is registration required? Where is your progress saved? Here are the most common questions and answers.
FAQ.meta_tw_desc: Detailed answers to everything you wanted to know about Ink: features, capabilities, plans, and author support.
FAQ.title: Frequently Asked Questions
FAQ.q1: What makes Ink different from other reading platforms?
FAQ.a1:
Ink combines the best of books and comics in one platform. You can not only read your favorite works, but also:
- Create collections, leave reviews, comment on chapters
- Get personalized recommendations based on your preferences
- Save and sync your reading progress across devices
- Enjoy gamification: earn experience, levels, and achievements for your activity.
FAQ.q2: How do reading lists work on Ink?
FAQ.a2:
Each user has a set of lists: "Reading", "Planned", "Completed", "Dropped", "Favorite", and "All".
You can add works to any of these lists or create your own — for example, "Summer Manga" or "Dark Novels".
It’s great for navigation, stats, and future recommendations.
FAQ.q3: What information can I see about a title?
FAQ.a3:
On a title’s page you’ll find:
- Key details (genres, status, translation, type, alt. names)
- Cover and a short description
- Rating and the number of users who’ve added it to their lists
- Chapters (for comics) or full text (for novels)
- Comments from other readers with ratings and replies
FAQ.a4:
Yes, most works are available to browse without signing in. But:
- Your reading progress won’t be saved
- You won’t be able to comment or rate titles
- You won’t get personalized recommendations
We recommend registering or logging in via Google, Discord, or GitHub — it only takes a few seconds.
FAQ.q5: Can I share my own work?
FAQ.a5:
Yes! We support creators. You can upload your novel or comic, choose genres, add a cover, metadata, and chapters.
After moderation, your work will appear on the platform. Authors can also receive likes, followers, and reviews.
FAQ.a6:
Yes, we’re working on a PWA version that already supports adding to the home screen and offline access to saved chapters.
In the future, we plan to release a full Ink app for Android and iOS.

Contacts.meta_description: Get in touch with the Ink team — tech support, copyright, social media, and legal inquiries. We’re always available.
Contacts.meta_og_desc: Have a question or suggestion? Message us! Tech support, copyright, Discord, Telegram — you’ll find us everywhere.
Contacts.meta_tw_desc: Contact the Ink team — tech support, social media, legal address. We reply quickly and to the point.
Contacts.title: Contacts
Contacts.intro: If you have any questions, suggestions, or want to report an issue — reach out to us via one of the following methods:
Contacts.tech_note: We respond within 24 hours on business days.
Contacts.dmca_note: Please include a link to the infringing content and proof of ownership in your message.
Contacts.address_body:
10 Prykladna St., Ivano-Frankivsk, 76000, Ukraine
(for official documents or legal correspondence)
Contacts.outro: We value your feedback and are open to collaboration.

Terms2.title: Terms of Use
Terms2.meta_description: Review the rules for using the Ink platform: registration, content publishing, liability, intellectual property, and privacy policy.
Terms2.s1_p1: These Terms of Use govern access to and usage of the Ink web platform (hereinafter referred to as the Platform), which provides tools for reading, publishing, and discussing book content.
Terms2.s1_p2: By using the Platform, you agree to these terms. If you do not agree with any part of them — please stop using the service.
Terms2.s2_p1: To gain full access to the Platform’s features, you must create an account. You are responsible for keeping your login and password confidential.
Terms2.s2_p2: The administration reserves the right to block or delete accounts that violate the rules or remain inactive for over 6 months.
Terms2.s3_p1: You may publish comments, reviews, add titles, and other content, provided you comply with the laws of Ukraine. It is forbidden to publish content that contains hate speech, promotes violence, or infringes copyrights.
Terms2.s3_p2: You grant the Platform a non-exclusive license to use your content within the site to ensure its functionality.
Terms2.s4_title: 4. Rights and Responsibilities of the Parties
Terms2.s4_user_rights: The user has the right to
Terms2.s4_r2: create collections, lists, and add friends;
Terms2.s4_d1: not duplicate or copy other users’ content without permission;
Terms2.s4_d2: not abuse the rating system or create fake accounts;
Terms2.s4_d3: respect other users on the platform.
Terms2.s5_p1: All Platform content, excluding user content — including design, logic, code, logos — is the intellectual property of the administration or its partners.
Terms2.s5_p2: It is forbidden to copy, publish, modify, or distribute such materials without written permission.
Terms2.s6_intro: The Platform is provided 'as is'. The administration is not responsible for:
Terms2.s6_li2: data loss caused by third-party attacks or user errors;
Terms2.s7_p: We process only the minimum necessary data — nickname, email, avatar, reading progress, etc. See our Privacy Policy for more details.
Terms2.s8_p: The administration may amend these Terms without prior notice. The current version is always available on this page.
Terms2.s9_p: If you have any questions about these terms, please contact us via email

Cookies.meta_description: Learn how Ink uses cookies for session storage, personalization, analytics, and improved security. Manage cookies in your browser settings.
Cookies.og_description: We explain which cookies we use on Ink, why we need them, and how you can control them.
Cookies.twitter_description: Read how Ink handles cookies: sessions, language preferences, analytics, and personalization.
Cookies.title: Cookie Policy
Cookies.s1_p: Cookies are small text files stored on your device when you visit our website. They help recognize you among other users, save your preferences, and enhance your interaction with the Ink platform.
Cookies.s2_p: We use cookies for the following purposes:
Cookies.s2_l1: to maintain login status and session state;
Cookies.s2_l2: to remember your language preferences and interface settings;
Cookies.s2_l3: to analyze site usage (e.g., via Google Analytics);
Cookies.s2_l5: to ensure security (e.g., detect suspicious activity).
Cookies.s3_p: We use the following types of cookies:
Cookies.s3_l1_d: required for the site to function;
Cookies.s3_l3_d: help us understand how users interact with the platform;
Cookies.s3_l4_d: cookies from analytics, authentication, or social media services.
Cookies.s4_p: You can manage cookies through your browser settings. You may delete existing cookies or block new ones. However, some parts of the site may not work properly without essential cookies.
Cookies.s5_p: We may update this policy periodically. The current version is always available on this page.
Cookies.s6_p: If you have questions about cookies, please contact us via email
